snippet: As jury selection continues in the trial of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, Osama bin Laden’s son-in-law, the government asked the judge to bar the defense from referring to topics such as national security.
abstract: Jury selection continues in Manhattan in terrorism trial of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, who prosecutors say was a top adviser to Osama bin Laden, and specter of Sept 11 attacks looms heavily; federal prosecutors move to try to keep what they call 'potentially inflammatory topics,' such as Guantanamo Bay and national security, out of the case.
lead_paragraph: As jury selection continues in the trial of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, Osama bin Laden’s son-in-law, the government asked the judge to bar the defense from referring to topics such as national security.

headline.main: U.S. Seeking to Keep ‘Potentially Inflammatory Topics’ Out of Terrorism Trial
headline.print_headline: U.S. Wants to Put Some Topics Off Limits at Terror Trial
